Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
Heading: Put Me Out

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I make two people out of one. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles M

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am something people love or hate. I change peoples appearances and thoughts. If a person takes care of them self I will go up even higher. To some people I will fool them. To others I am a mystery. Some people might want to try and hide me but I will show. No matter how hard people try I will Never go down. What am I?
Heading: Priceless

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am white when I am dirty, and black when I am clean. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles B

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: My life can be measured in hours, I serve by being devoured. Thin, I am quick. Fat, I am slow. Wind is my foe. What am I?
Heading: Quick, No Time!

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: This is as light as a feather, yet no man can hold it for long. What am I?
Heading: Hard To Carry

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am taken from a mine, and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost everybody. What am I?
Heading: Wooden Case

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: The more you take away, the more I become. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles H

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have two hands, but I can not scratch myself. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles C

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: I Can Kill You

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am the beginning of the end, and the end of time and space. I am essential to creation, and I surround every place.


What am I?
Heading: I  Surround Every Place
Answer: The letter e. End, timE, spacE, Every placE

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can be cracked, I can be made. I can be told, I can be played. What am I?
Heading: Rival To The Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have no feet, no hands, no wings, but I climb to the sky. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles S

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Look in my face, I am somebody; Look in my back, I am nobody.


What am I?
Heading: Look In My Face

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I'm as small as an ant, as big as a whale. I'll approach like a breeze, but can come like a gale. By some I get hit, but all have shown fear. I'll dance to the music, though I can't hear. Of names I have many, of names I have one. I'm as slow as a snail, but from me you can't run. What am I?
Heading: What Am I Riddle?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am a word of six; my first three letters refer to an automobile; my last three letters refer to a household animal; my first four letters is a fish; my whole is found in your room. What am I?
Heading: Room Riddles

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have a little house in which I live all alone. It has no doors or windows, and if I want to go out I must break through the wall. What am I?
Heading: Lonely House

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: There was a green house. Inside the green house there was a white house Inside the white house there was a red house. Inside the red house there were lots of babies. What am I?
Heading: In A House In A House

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I'm tall when I'm young and I'm short when I'm old. What am I?
Heading: Tall When Young

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
You can touch me,


You can break me,


You should win me if you want to be mine.


What am I?
Heading: Win Me

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm white, and used for cutting and grinding. When I'm damaged, humans usually remove me or fill me. For most animals I am a useful tool.


What am I?
Heading: To Cut And Grind

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
You use a knife to slice my head and weep beside me when I am dead.


What am I?
Heading: The Knife

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Until I am measured I am not known, Yet how you miss me when I have flown.  What Am I?
Heading: I Can Fly Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can't be bought, but I can be stolen with a glance. I'm worthless to one, but priceless to two. What am I?
Heading: Bought And Stolen

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Four fingers and a thumb,


Yet flesh and blood,


I have none. 


What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles G

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I have a thousand needles but I do not sew.


What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles P

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
If you drop me, I'm sure to crack. Give me a smile, and I'll always smile back.


What am I?
Heading: Self Image

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I reach for the sky, but clutch to the ground; sometimes I leave, but I am always around. What am I?
Heading: Reach For The Sky

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I run all around the pasture but never move. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles F

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
You answer me, although I never ask you questions.


What am I?
Heading: Ring Ring

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I act like a cat, I look like a cat, Yet I am not a cat. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles K

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: No matter how little or how much you use me, you change me every month. What am I?
Heading: Month To Month

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am wet when drying. What am I?
Heading: Not Easy

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am strong enough to smash ships, but I fear the Sun. What am I?
Heading: Strong Enough But.... What Am I?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am six letters. When you take one away I am twelve. What am I?
Heading: Six Then Twelve

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I always follow you around, everywhere you go at night. I look very bright to people, but I can make the sun dark. I can be in many different forms and shapes. What am I?
Heading: A "What Am I?" Question

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I run in and out of town all day and night. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles R

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Tool of thief, toy of queen. Always used to be unseen. Sign of joy, sign of sorrow. Giving all likeness borrowed. What am I?
Heading: To Be Unseen

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I may be simple, I may be complex; I may have a name, but no gender or sex; I am often a question, or statements as a setup; I tend to have an answer, 'til you find it I won't let up. What am I?
Heading: I May Be...

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I'm found in socks, scarves and mittens. I'm found in the paws of playful kittens. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles Y

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: A very pretty thing am I, fluttering in the pale-blue sky. Delicate, fragile on the wing, indeed I am a pretty thing. What am I?
Heading: Fragile Beauty

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: A slender body, a tiny eye, no matter what happens, I never cry. What am I?
Heading: A Slender Body

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I was carried into a dark room, and set on fire. I wept, and then my head was cut off. What am I?
Heading: Sad Thing

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I never was, am always to be. No one ever saw me, nor ever will. And yet I am the confidence of all, To live and breathe on this terrestrial ball.


What am I?
Heading: No One Ever Saw Me, Nor Ever Will

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am the beginning of sorrow, and the end of sickness. You cannot express happiness without me, yet I am in the midst of crosses. I am always in risk, yet never in danger. You may find me in the sun, but I am never out of darkness. What am I?
Heading: Happiness!

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: A little pool with two layers of wall around it. One white and soft and the other dark and hard, amidst a light brown grassy lawn with an outline of a green grass. What am I?
Heading: Delicious Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I'm so fast you can't see me, though everyone else can see straight through me. I don't stop until the day you die. What am I?
Heading: Riddle Me This?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Some will use me, while others will not, some have remembered, while others have forgot. For profit or gain, I'm used expertly, I can't be picked off the ground or tossed into the sea. Only gained from patience and time, can you unravel my rhyme? What am I?
Heading: Smarter Than You

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I pass before the sun, yet make no shadow. What am I?
Heading: You Can't See Me

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I'm the part of the bird that's not in the sky. I can swim in the ocean and yet remain dry. What am I?
Heading: Part Of A Bird

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can be long, or I can be short. I can be grown, and I can be bought. I can be painted, or left bare. I can be round, or square. What am I?
Heading: Pretty Little Things

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I run through hills; I veer around mountains. I leap over rivers and crawl through the forests. Step out your door to find me.


What am I?
Heading: Step Out Your Door To Find Me

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: When I point up it's bright, but when I point down it's dark. What am I?
Heading: Here's A Pointer

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am useless when together but useful when I am broken apart. What am I?
Heading: Is It Useful Or Not

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I look at you, you look at me, I raise my right, you raise your left. What am I?
Heading: Stop Copying Me!

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I always have one eye open.


What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles N

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Lighter than what I am made of, More of me is hidden Than is seen. What am I?
Heading: Hidden Weight

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
The things I bite, they don't bleed, 


I don't bite until you push me; 


I bring my victims together each time I bite, 


But they'll come undone if you pull it just right. 


What am I?
Heading: Bring My Victims Together

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Like A Doll

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: The more there is the less you see. What is it?
Heading: Think Literally

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am a path situated between high natural masses. Remove my first letter and you have a path situated between man-made masses.


What am I?
Heading: Remove My First Letter

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am the ruler of shovels, I have a double. I am as thin as a knife, I have a wife. What am I?
Heading: Thin As A Knife
Answer: The King of Spades (from a deck of cards).

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: You can't see me, but I can see you; To be more specific, I see through. What am I?
Heading: I See Through

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I don't have eyes, but once I did see. Once I had thoughts, but now I'm white and empty. What am I?
Heading: Once I Had Thoughts

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: They fill me up and you empty me, almost everyday; if you raise my arm, I work the opposite way. What am I?
Heading: Opposite Way

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: You can drop me from the tallest building and I will be well, but if u drop me in water I die. What am I?
Heading: Drop

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: More Taste

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have no voice and yet I speak to you, I tell of all things in the world that people do. I have leaves, but I am not a tree, I have pages, but I am not a bride or royalty. I have a spine and hinges, but I am not a man or a door, I have told you all, I cannot tell you more. What am I?
Heading: Read My Lips

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I have four legs but never walk I may be covered in flowers but have no soil I hold food three times a day but never eat a meal.


What am I?
Heading: Never Eat

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
The more of these you take, the more appear behind you.


What am I?
Heading: More Appear

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am served at a table, In gatherings of two or four; Served small, white and round. You'll love some, And that's part of the fun. What am I?
Heading: Small, Round And White Challenge

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: You go at red, but stop at green. What am I?
Heading: Stop And Go
Answer: Watermelon! You eat the red part, and you stop eating at the green part.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am a stain in your memories, many times you question me. What am I?
Heading: A Stain

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am essential to life, yet I can take your breath away. I am both in you and around you. What am I?
Heading: It's Not Air

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Pronounced as one letter, And written with three, Two letters there are, And two only in me. I'm double, I'm single, I'm black, blue, and gray, I'm read from both ends, And the same either way. What am I?
Heading: Same Either Way

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have a big mouth and I am also quite loud! I am NOT a gossip but I do get involved with everyone's dirty business. What am I?
Heading: All The Dirty Places

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can fill a room or just one heart. Others can have me, but I can't be shared. What am I?
Heading: Fill And Heart

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I look flat, but I am deep, Hidden realms I shelter. Lives I take, but food I offer. At times I am beautiful. I can be calm, angry and turbulent. I have no heart, but offer pleasure as well as death. No man can own me, yet I encompass what all men must have. What am I?
Heading: Flat, Yet Deep

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I fly when I am born, lie when I'm alive, and run when I am dead. 


What am I?
Heading: Dead Running

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have four wings, but cannot fly, I never laugh and never cry; On the same spot I'm always found, toiling away with little sound. What am I?
Heading: Four Wings Around

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am two-faced but bare only one, I have no legs but travel widely. Men spill much blood over me, kings leave there imprint on me. I have greatest power when given away, yet lust for me keeps me locked away.


What am I?
Heading: Lust Keeps Me Locked Away

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Spelled forwards I'm what you do everyday, Spelled backwards I'm something you hate. What am I?
Heading: The Worst Of Things

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I fit in with other people, but I can not talk. I create pictures, but I can not see. What am I?
Heading: I’m So Cool

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: With pointed fangs it sits in wait, With piercing force its doles out fate, Over bloodless victims proclaiming its might, Eternally joining in a single bite. What am I?
Heading: With Pointed Fangs It Sits In Wait... What Am I?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
You buy me taken apart, 


To redo what has been undone; 


Four of my pieces have one sharp corner, 


The rest of them have none. 


What am I?
Heading: Redo What Has Been Undone

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Until I am measured, I am not known. Yet how you miss me, When I have flown.


What am I?
Heading: Miss Me Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Different lights do make me strange, thus into different sizes I will change. What am I?
Heading: Always Change
Answer: I am the pupil of an eye.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I start with the letter e, I end with the letter e. I contain only one letter, Yet I am not the letter e!


What am I?
Heading: Contain Only One Letter

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I follow you by day, by night I blend right in but no one sees me except when I'm in the light. What am I?
Heading: Day And Night

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can be hairy and itchy all over. I hang on a stick. I can be the scariest thing you have ever seen. I stand in the middle of nowhere. What am I?
Heading: Middle Of Nowhere

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can hurt, I can help, I'm kind, Sometimes I'm not, I can be said, You can hear me, Yet you can't see neither touch me. What am I?
Heading: Do You Know?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am four letters long, I can be seen in the sky, I am the ocean & I am the sea. Can you guess me?
Heading: Sky And Ocean

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am never quite what I appear to be. Straight-forward I seem, but it's only skin deep, for mystery most often lies beneath my simple speech. Sharpen your wits, open your eyes, look beyond my exteriors, read me backwards, forwards, upside down. Think critically and answer the question.


What am I?
Heading: Straight-forward I Seem

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am free yet priceless, you can't own me but you can use me, you can't keep me but you can spend me. Once you lost me you can never have me back. What am I?
Heading: Free Yet Priceless Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: A thousand colored folds stretch toward the sky, Atop a tender strand, Rising from the land, 'Til killed by maiden's hand, Perhaps a token of love, perhaps to say goodbye. What am I?
Heading: Token Of Love - What Am I?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am a box that holds keys without locks, yet they can unlock your soul. What am I?
Heading: Special Keys

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm made of eight letters,


But hold a ninth inside;


Pay a very small fee,


And send me for a ride.


What am I?
Heading: Send Me For A Ride

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Squeeze me and I cry tears as red as flesh, but my heart is made of stone.


What am I?
Heading: Tears As Red As Flesh

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am a rock group that has 4 members, all of whom are dead, one of which was assasinated. What am I?
Heading: More Word Play
Answer: Mount Rushmore.  Get it, rock group?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
No legs have I to dance, 
 No lungs have I to breathe, 
 No life have I to live or die 
 And yet I do all three. 
 What am I?
Heading: No Legs Have I To Dance

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no-body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I?
Heading: I Speak Without A Mouth And Hear Without Ears...

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm always in charge, I'm never in debt. I'm known as the first amongst all my kind. I'm found within cars, But never in buses. I'm not used in Mexico, I'm used in Palestine.


What am I?
Heading: Always In Charge

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm under your face,


I'm outside your mind;


A biological case,


Pressure brings pain sometimes.


What am I?
Heading: Biological Case

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Guess Who I Am

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
With pointed fangs it sits in wait, 
 With piercing force its doles out fate, 
 Over bloodless victims proclaiming its might, 
 Eternally joining in a single bite. 
 What am I?
Heading: With Pointed Fangs It Sits In Wait,

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
If you break me I do not stop working, 
If you touch me I may be snared, 
If you lose me nothing will matter. 
What am I?
Heading: Don't Break Me Brain Challenge

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I cause death yet make your day. I am your friend, but your enemy. I am the beginning and end. What am I?
Heading: The Cause Of Death

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I'm flat when I'm new. I'm fat when you use me. I release my gas when something sharp touches me. What am I?
Heading: Use It And It's Fat

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: You're both in and outside of me; You guide me but don't ride me; I can make a statement with a tongue but no mouth. What am I?
Heading: Tongue But No Mouth

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I weaken all men for hours each day. I show you strange visions while you are away. I take you by night, by day take you back, None suffer to have me, but do from my lack.


What am I?
Heading: I Weaken All Men

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I turn around once. What is out will not get in. I turn around again. What is in will not get out. What am I?
Heading: In And Out

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Double my number, I'm less than a score, half of my number is less than four. Add one to my double when bakers are near, days of the week are still greater, I fear.


What am I?
Heading: My Number

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I move without wings, between silken strings, I leave as you find, my substance behind.


What am I?
Heading: Between Silken Strings

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am born in fear, raised in truth, and I come to my own in deed. When comes a time that I'm called forth, I come to serve the cause of need.


What am I?
Heading: Born In Fear

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
What force and strength cannot get through, I with a gentle touch can do. And many in the street would stand, were I not a friend at hand. 


What am I?
Heading: Cannot Get Through

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I can be short and sometimes hot. When displayed, I rarely impress.


What am I?
Heading: Rarely Impress

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can travel from there to here by disappearing, and here to there by reappearing.  What am I?
Heading: From There To Here

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I say everything I hear to others around. I'm not an animal, nor part of the human race. I will, immediately, repeat after you; But only if my tail is in place. What am I?
Heading: Repeat After Me

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My life is often a volume of grief, your help is needed to turn a new leaf. Stiff is my spine and my body is pale, but I'm always ready to tell a tale.


What am I?
Heading: Volume Of Grief

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Almost everyone sees me without noticing me, For what is beyond is what he or she seeks. What am I?
Heading: Unnoticed

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Late afternoons I often bathe. I'll soak in water piping hot. My essence goes through my see through clothes. Used up am I; I've gone to pot. What am I?
Heading: In Piping Hot Water

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have two arms, but fingers none. I have two feet, but cannot run. I carry well, but I have found I carry best with my feet OFF the ground. What am I?
Heading: I Can Move Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Only two back bones and a thousand ribs.


What am I?
Heading: Hammer And Steel

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
You go in me for brushing, 


For flushing, 


For rushing; 


But please go in me one at a time, 


Or someone might be blushing. 


What am I?
Heading: One At A Time

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Lasting Devastation

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: When I am filled I can point the way, When I am empty nothing moves me, I have two skins, one without and one within. What am I?
Heading: Without And Within

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: In spring I am gay in handsome array; in summer more clothing I wear; when colder it grows I fling off my clothes; and in winter quite naked appear. What am I?
Heading: Changing And Changing

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I have four legs and one back, yet I can't walk


What am I?
Heading: I Can't Walk

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Three lives have I. Gentle enough to soothe the skin, Light enough to caress the sky, Hard enough to crack rocks. What am I?
Heading: Three Lives Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Sometimes I move fast,


Sometimes I move slow;


But my speed is truly constant,


And nowhere I go.


What am I?
Heading: Truly Constant

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am the only thing that always tells the truth. I show off everything that I see. I come in all shapes and sizes. So tell me what I must be! What am I?
Heading: All Shapes And Sizes
Answer: I must be a mirror, of course.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: You throw me away, I find my way back; Traditionally I'm wooden, With an arch in my back. What am I?
Heading: I Find My Way Back

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: What has 4 legs when it is young, 2 legs when its not old but is about to be, and has 3 legs when it is old. What am I?
Heading: Ages Of Evolution
Answer: I am a human. I crawl on 4 legs when I am a baby I walk on 2 legs when I am an adult, and I have a cane while walking when I am old.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I lead the way into the unknown, and bring strength where there is fear. I am the creator of invention, and the maker of all adventure. What am I?
Heading: Lead The Way

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Three lives have I. 
 Gentle enough to soothe the skin, 
 Light enough to caress the sky, 
 Hard enough to crack rocks. 
What am I?
Heading: I Have Three Lives

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I can sizzle like bacon, I am made with an egg, I have plenty of backbone, but lack a good leg, I peel layers like onions, but still remain whole, I can be long, like a flagpole, yet fit in a hole.


What am I?
Heading: Sizzle Like Bacon

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am always hungry, I must always be fed, The finger I lick Will soon turn red.
Heading: Hungry For...

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
There was a green house. 
 Inside the green house there was a white house 
 Inside the white house there was a red house. 
 Inside the red house there were lots of babies 
 What am I?
Heading: Lots Of Houses Lots Of Babies

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have many feathers to help me fly. I have a body and head, but I'm not alive. It is your strength which determines how far I go. You can hold me in your hand, but I'm never thrown. What am I?
Heading: Mastery Of Range

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Remove my forth letter and the first three letters will spell a school subject. My last five letters spell something that happens when swallowing a carrot whole. My whole spells a vegetable. What am I?
Heading: Subject: Carrot

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: What kind of a band, never plays music?
Heading: Band Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: At the sound of me, men may dream, Or stamp their feet. At the sound of me, women may laugh, Or sometimes weep. What am I?
Heading: I Play Emotions Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I make you weak at the worst of all times. I keep you safe, I keep you fine. I make your hands sweat, and your heart grow cold, I visit the weak, but seldom the bold. What am I?
Heading: Brave Enough?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Poke your fingers in my eyes and I will open wide my jaws. Linen cloth, quills, or paper, my greedy lust devours them all. What am I?
Heading: Greedy Lust

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: On my own, I am darkness, a black abyss. But, Life brings me light with its gentle kiss. I am quiet and cold, but warmth I can hold. Alongside beauties and wonders, sights to be told. My surface may be bare, this I'm aware. But, beautiful secrets I am eager to share. My mouth so large, I swallow you whole. To be in my belly is your goal. What may lie within can drive men to sin. Greed and desire, gluttony's kin. For some, I am fear. For others, hope. My perception shaped from life's scope. From the earth I have come, and forever will stay, even if parts of me crumble away. What am I?
Heading: Riddle MB This*

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Alive without breath, As cold as death, Never thirsty, Ever drinking, Clad in mail, Never clinking, Drowns on dry land, Thinks an island Is a mountain, Thinks a fountain Is a puff of air. What am I?
Heading: Drown On Land

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Duels of good and evil, 
 A fighter of good am I, 
 Revealed beside watched words, 
 King of the black night sky. 
 
 What am I?
Heading: A Clever Word Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Without a bridle, or a saddle, across a thing I ride a-straddle. And those I ride, by help of me, though almost blind, are made to see.


What am I?
Heading: No Saddle!

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: When I am metal or wood, I bring you home. When I am flesh and blood, in the darkness I roam. What am I?
Heading: The Flesh And Wood

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: When you stop and look, you can always see me. If you try to touch you cannot feel me. I cannot move, but as you near me, I will move away from you. What am I?
Heading: Beyond Your Reach

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My teeth are sharp, my back is straight, to cut things up it is my fate.


What am I?
Heading: To Cut Things Up Is My Fate

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Bright as diamonds, Loud as thunder, Never still, A thing of wonder. What am I?
Heading: Wonderful And Bright

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Crimson I am born, yellow I dance, ebony I die. What am I?
Heading: 3nigma

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Large as a mountain, small as a pea, 
Endlessly swimming in a waterless sea. 
What am I?
Heading: Endless Sea

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm by nature solitary, scarred by spear and wounded by sword, weary of battle. I frequently see the face of war, and fight hateful enemies; yet I hold no hope of help being brought to me in the battle, before I'm eventually done to death. In the stronghold of the city sharp-edged swords, skilfully forged in the flame by smiths, bite deeply into me. I can but await a more fearsome encounter; it is not for me to discover in the city any of those doctors who heal grievous wounds with roots and herbs. The scars from sword wounds gape wider and wider; death blows are dealt to me by day and by night.


What am I?
Heading: Weary Of Battle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I'm blue at day and black at night; I do contain some creatures born and died. What am I?
Heading: Substance

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Dark with white markings, And smooth like a rock. Where learning occurs, I help convey thought. What am I?
Heading: Educational Presentations

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Shoot at me a thousand times and I may still survive; one scratch from me and you will find your prospects take a dive.


What am I?
Heading: Scratch

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can be all colours of the rainbow, Or have no colour at all. Sometimes I'm empty, Sometimes I'm full. What am I?
Heading: Rhyming What Am I?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am mother and father, but never birth or nurse. I'm rarely still, but I never wander.


What am I?
Heading: Swaying In The Wind

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I herald the darkness which descends on all creatures; You will know my approach by moans and wracked features. I visit the hippo, hyena, and horse, But never go near snails and spiders, of course. I would circle the globe, leaping one to the other, Should all the world's people ever clasp hands together.


What am I?
Heading: Wracked Features

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am a food,


I have only three letters in my name;


Leave the first,


I still sound the same.


What am I?
Heading: Sound The Same

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Find Me All Around

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I know a word of letters three. Add two, and fewer there will be! What Word Am I?
Heading: Three Letter Word Trivia Challenge

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Round as a button, Deep as a well. If you want me to talk, You must first pull my tail.


What am I?
Heading: Round As A Button, Deep As A Well

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: I’m In The Book, But Not On Any Leaf

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I have endless make-overs but I never know my look. I can make any dull room bright.


What am I?
Heading: Make-overs

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am not as they say, But I am in the way. I'm not the answer to the question, More an alternative suggestion. What am I?
Heading: Not The Answer.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am a word of three syllables, each of which is a word; my first is an article in common use; my second, an animal of uncommon intelligence; my third, though not an animal, is used in carrying burdens. My whole is a useful art. What am I?
Heading: Three Syllable Word

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Weight in my belly, Trees on my back, Nails in my ribs, Feet I do lack. What am I?
Heading: Not Human

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am black of eye and bright of hair. I fast in to the ground and follow my lord as he races around the world.


What am I?
Heading: Follow My Lord

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I build up castles. I tear down mountains. I make some men blind, I help others to see. What am I?
Heading: Blindingly Helpful

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I can flutter and take your breath away. I can take a beating, but do not bruise. If I stopped you would be sure to lose. Everyday I am with you.


What am I?
Heading: Beating

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Fire is often maintained above me, and if you remove my first letter, you will find the home shared by everyone you have ever known.


What am I?
Heading: Fire Maintained Above

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am the tool, for inspiring many. Buy me in the store, for not much more than a penny. Don't overuse me, or my usefulness will go, what am I? Do you know?
Heading: Not Much More Than A Penny

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm pleasing to the eye A tool for many absent of mind A tapestry of fickle lies Blind to even the most pensive spies I'm often the breeder of fervent lust But I am by far one you shouldn't trust.


What am I?
Heading: Breeder Of Fervent Lust

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My first is in wield, sever bones and marrow. My second is in blade, forged in cold steel. My third is in arbalest, and also in arrows. My fourth is in power, plunged through a shield. My fifth is in honour, and also in vows My last will put an end to it all.


What am I?
Heading: Plunged Through A Shield

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Stealthy as a shadow in the dead of night, 
Cunning but affectionate if given a bite. 
Never owned but often loved. 
At my sport considered cruel, 
But that's because you never know me at all. 

What am I?
Heading: Stealth

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: You use me for my name, I'm not a breeze to tame, I'm fastest when I'm full and when it's cheap it sounds the same. You'll spot a nest near me (although I'm not a tree), the sea is fore, the sea is aft, it's all around, you see.  What am I?
Heading: No Breeze

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My first is a part of the day,






My last a conductor of light,


My whole to take measure of time,


Is useful by day and by night.


What am I?
Heading: Conductor Of Light

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am, in truth, a yellow fork
From tables in the sky
By inadvertent fingers dropped
The awful cutlery.
Of mansions never quite disclosed
And never quite concealed
The apparatus of the dark
To ignorance revealed.
Heading: A Yellow Fork

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
From house to house he goes, A messenger small and slight. And whether it rains or snows, He sleeps outside at night.


What am I?
Heading: House To House

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: When you stare at me u see a you in reverse. What am I?
Heading: What Am I

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My second is performed by my first, and, it is thought, a thief by the marks of my whole might be caught.


What am I?
Heading: The Marks By My Whole Might Get Me Caught

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am everything to somone but nothing to everyone else.


What am I?
Heading: Nothing To Everyone Else

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I build up castles. 
 I tear down mountains. 
 I make some men blind, 
 I help others to see. 
 What am I?
Heading: What Buildes Castles

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Part carbon, part water, I am poison to the fishes. Many have falsely claimed my name, for I am the pause that refreshes.


What am I?
Heading: Poison To The Fishes

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Narrow Road

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Ten Men's Strength, 
Ten Men's Length, 
Ten Men can't break it, 
Yet a young boy walks off with it 

What am I?
Heading: Unbreakable

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Though liquid in nature, don't push me too far; for then I will break, and the damage may scar.


What am I?
Heading: Don't Push Me Too Far

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
A red cap on my head, A stone in my throat, you tell me the answer, I'll give you a Groat.


What am I?
Heading: Stone In My Throat

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My dress is tranquil when I tread the earth, or dwell at home, or drift on the water. Sometimes my wings and this wide sky lift me over the dwellings of men, and then strong clouds carry me over the people. My ornaments echo loudly and melodiously, Illustriously sing when I am not near the earth and stream, a sailing spirit.


What am I?
Heading: Sailing Spirit

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm red and I can be green or yellow,


what am I?
Heading: Three Colors

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Matter Of Taste

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am served at a table, In gatherings of two or four. Served small, white and round. You'll love some, And that's part of the fun.


What am I?
Heading: Gatherings Of Tow Or Four

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm a seed that's underground. Many like to spread me around. But my family it's said is quite insane. And if you've a low I.Q. you've this kind of brain. Eat me raw and I'll make you sick. Eat too much and your tongue will stick.


What am I?
Heading: Spread Me Around

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Black and Blue. Red and Green. Yellow and Blue. Green and Grey. I am all colours. You can try to get close to me, but you can't escape my vision. If you get greedy, you will try to take your colours for yourself, but before you know it, I will be eating you for lunch. What am I?
Heading: Colours

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Motion To Make Words

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I talk, but I do not speak my mind
I hear words, but I do not listen to thoughts
When I wake, all see me
When I sleep, all hear me
Many heads are on my shoulders
Many hands are at my feet
The strongest steel cannot break my visage
But the softest whisper can destroy me
The quietest whimper can be heard.
Heading: Roosevelt's What Am I Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I cover what's real, hide what is true, but sometimes bring out the courage in you. What am I?
Heading: Just For Girls Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Adored by few, Feared and hated by many. Mistress of the entire universal reason, Master in the art of numbers. Some may have solved many of your mysteries, But there still much of them to find. What are they?
Heading: Art Of Numbers

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: If a man carried my burden He would break his back. I am not rich, But leave silver in my track.
Heading: Crawling

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am, in truth, a yellow fork From tables in the sky By inadvertent fingers dropped The awful cutlery. Of mansions never quite disclosed And never quite concealed The apparatus of the dark To ignorance revealed.
Heading: The Dark Mystery

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am at the beginning of all things. I am at the end of eternity. There is but one path from my beginning to my end. My whole embodies indifference.


What am I?
Heading: End Of Eternity

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I exist, but have no material form. I am made of numbers, but appear square. I build upon other of my own, but do not topple down. I sit still and do nothing, but I'm still useful. What am I?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Close to the words of life stay I, But I wither, wane, and dry.


What am I?
Heading: Wither, Wane, And Dry

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I give you a group of three. One is sitting down, and will never get up. The second eats as much as is given to him, yet is always hungry. The third goes away and never returns.
Heading: A Naughty Trio Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I have two rings. I move by request. If the mixture is not right, I just sit at rest.


What am I?
Heading: Two Rings

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am filled with hotness. I don't mind how hot water is.


What am I?
Heading: Filled With Hotness

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My first is not bent around. My second means "lift her up" or "cut her to the ground."


What am I?
Heading: "Cut Her To The Ground"

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: My name starts with "rain" and ends with the first letter of my name. I get mistaken for other things a lot. I am usually present in children's stories. I am usually flying in mid-air too. What am I?
Heading: What Am I?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Of all vegetables, only two can live to produce on their own for several growing seasons. All other vegetables must be replanted every year. What are the only two perennial vegetables?
Heading: Vegetables!

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Grow Near The Water

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Ripped from my mother's womb, Beaten and burned, I become a blood-thirsty slayer. What am I?
Heading: Blood Thirsty

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My head and tail both equal are, My middle slender as a bee. Whether I stand on head or heel Is quite the same to you or me. But if my head should be cut off, The matter's true, though passing strange Directly I to nothing change.


What Am I?
Heading: Head Or Heel

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
When young, I am sweet in the sun.
When middle-aged, I make you gay.
When old, I am valued more than ever.
What am I?
Heading: Sweet In The Sun

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: My full powers come when my makers are dead; I await a heavy hat to put on my head. What am I?
Heading: Full Powers

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Out With Left, In With Right.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
You will find me with four legs, but no hair.
People ride me for hours, but I don't go anywhere.
Without needing to be tugged, jerked or turned on,
I always manage to be ready for work.
What am I?
Heading: Ready For Work

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am not found on any ground,
But always in the air; 
Though charged each cloud with thunder loud, 
You can not find me there. 
Now, if from France you choose to dance 
Your way just into Spain, 
I there am seen, and near the queen, 
In hail, in mist, and rain.


What am I?
Heading: Enigma, I Am Found On The Ground...

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
A box without hinges, key or lid, Yet golden treasure inside is hid.


What am I?
Heading: Golden Treasure

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Pregnant every time you see her, 
yet she never will give birth.
What is she?
Heading: Pregnancy Alert

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Weight in my belly,
Trees on my back.
Nails in my ribs,
Feet I do lack.
Heading: Build Me Or Sink Me Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I come across as flat,


But theirs more to me than my surface;


You climb my moutains from top to bottom,


And fall from bottom to top.


What am I?
Heading: More To Me

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Come By The Millions

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I am the fountain from which no one can drink. For many I am considered a necessary link. Like gold to all I am sought for, But my continued death brings wealth for all to want more. What am I?
Heading: Necessary Link

Riddle: What is the noblest musical instrument?
Heading: What Is The Noblest Musical Instrument?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I can run but not walk. Whereever I go, thought follows me close behind?
Heading: Snotty

Riddle:
I can kill people, but without me there would be no people. I was born long ago and will someday die. I can cause fire and am a magician with water. I have more brothers than any person. There is very little that can stop me.


What am I?
Heading: Unstoppable

Riddle: What animal would you get crossed a duck, a beaver, and an otter?
Heading: Odd Animals

Riddle: I have four legs but no tail. Usually I am heard only at night. What am I?
Heading: Four Legs Night Owl Brain Teazer

Riddle: At the sound of me, men may dream or stomp their feet at the sound of me, women may laugh or sometimes weep. What am I?

Riddle: When young, I am sweet in the sun. When middle-aged, I make you gay. When old, I am valued more than ever. What am I?

Riddle:
I'm sometimes white,
Although sometimes I'm black.
I take you there,
But never bring you back. What am I?
Heading: White And Black

Riddle: If a man carried my burden he would break his back. I am not big but leave silver in my tracks. What am I?
Heading: Not Big

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: My first is in chocolate but not in ham, my second's in cake and also in jam, my third at tea-time is easily found, my whole is a friend who's often around. What am I?
Heading: Furry Friend

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Letters Of The Alphabet

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Of no use to one Yet absolute bliss to two. The small boy gets it for nothing. The young man has to lie for it. The old man has to buy it. The baby's right, The lover's privilege, The hypocrite's mask. To the young girl, faith; To the married woman, hope; To the old maid, charity. What am I?
Heading: Of No Use

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: What do you use to hoe a row, slay a foe, and wring with woe?
Heading: Everyone's Got It

Riddle: What animal probably likes doors?
Heading: An Animal And A Door

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Runs over fields and woods all day Under the bed at night sits not alone, With long tongue hanging out, Awaiting for a bone. What am I?
Heading: Tongue Hanging

Riddle: When you add meat to me, I become vegetarian. What am I?
Heading: A Meaty Conundrum

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Heading: Enigma, Tis Whispered In Heaven

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
My tines be long,
 My tines be short,
 My tines end ere,
 My first report.,
 What am I?
Heading: Long And Short

Riddle: Untainted, Eternal, Marooned A place where the living will move. A shrine beneath the sun. Greeted by the morning's crest. Our sanctity, Our rest. For when our day is done. What am I?

The riddle

 without pinching 
 It sits on the stove
 without burning

Riddle:
I am a tick, I am usually black or white, You will find me on many clothing, People think I am cool.


What am I?

Riddle: Through me you see through things. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles X

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I build up castles. I tear down mountains. I make some men blind, I help others to see. What am I?
Heading: The Good And The Bad

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I am just two and two. I am hot. I am cold. I am the parent of numbers that cannot be told. I am a gift beyond measure, a matter of course. I am given with pleasure when taken by force. 


What am I?
Heading: Two Plus Two

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I have a mouth, no butt, two cranes and floating vessels. What am I?
Heading: Riddle Is Funny!

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: My fleece is white as snow. Everywhere that Mary goes, I go. What am I?
Heading: Kids Riddles L

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I like to be blue and have been since '63, but I could be anything if my circuit was fixed. I'm small yet infinitely bigger. I was grown but I'm made of metal. I am the last of my kind just like my beautiful idiot once was. Together we will travel, have traveled or are traveling. Tenses as seen, seeing, will see, are mysterious to me. Wibblies and wobblies, time correctly described by a Lord. What will I be, what have I been, or is it, what am I?
Heading: WHO Have I Been, Will I Be, Or WHO Am I?

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I was born in the 18th century, yet still live on today. Appearing on TV when I have something to say. Called everything from "honest" to a dirty rotten "crook", I used to wear a wig, but have had several looks. I've always had a party, but never disturb the neighbors. I've been shot at many times - major stories for the papers. What am I?
Heading: 18th Century
Answer: The Office of the President of the United States.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Not born, but from a Mother's body drawn, I hang until half of me is gone. I sleep in a cave until I grow old, then valued for my hardened gold. What am I?
Heading: Smelly But Good

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
A little house full of meat, no door to go in and eat.


What am I?
Heading: House Of Meat

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
As a whole, I am both safe and secure. Behead me, and I become a place of meeting. Behead me again, and I am the partner of ready. Restore me, and I become the domain of beasts.


What am I?
Heading: I Am Safe And Secure.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Where is there is no south, west, nor east, and weather not fit for man or beast
Heading: Not South West Nor East

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Our dinner guests cry that we are evil, when they notice their place in the meal. But its no big deal why; we are just one big happy tribe! And we get reall fed up with people!


Who, What or Are we?
Heading: The Dinner Guests

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: I'm a word that's hardly there. Take away my start, and I'm an herbal flair. What am I?
Heading: A Word That's Hardly There Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Of no use to one Yet absolute bliss to two. The small boy gets it for nothing. The young man has to lie for it. The old man has to buy it. The baby's right, The lover's privilege, The hypocrite's mask. To the young girl, faith; To the married woman, hope; To the old maid, charity. What am I?
Heading: Of No Use To One

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
A woman who lives in new york legally married three men, she did not get divorce, get an enollment, or legally seperate.


How is this possible?
Heading: Marriage Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I can come in a can,


I can come as a punch,


I can come as a win,


You can eat me for lunch.


What am I?
Heading: Come As A Punch

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: My first is a creature whose breeding is unclear. My second, a price you must pay. My whole can be found in the river of Time and refers to events of today. What am I?
Heading: Events Of Today

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Marking mortal privation, when firmly in place. An enduring summation, inscribed in my face.


What am I?
Heading: Mortal Privation

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
When I'm used, I'm useless, once offered, soon rejected. In desperation oft expressed, the intended not protected.


What am I?
Heading: Used Uselessly

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
The land was white the seed was black 
 It'll take a good scholar to riddle me that. What am I?
Heading: Black And White Riddle

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
There where 5 men travling down a road and it started to rain and 4 men sped up, the 5th did not, but they all arived at the same place at the same time but all of them were wet besides the 5th


how?
Heading: 5 Men
Answer: he was dead. in a coffin

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
Many-manned scud-thumper, Maker of worn wood, Shrub-ruster, Sky-mocker, Rave! Portly pusher, Wind-slave.


What am I?
Heading: Wild-slave

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
I'm one of five, I'm not alive. The one who sent me forth became king, The one who received me died.


What am I?
Heading: One Of Five
Answer: A Stone from the popular Biblical story, David had five stones. He used one of the stones to kill Goliath.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle:
You can use me to stop,


You take me to smoke;


Not only do I stop, But I am a stop,


And the result of pool's first stroke.


What am I?
Heading: Take Me To Smoke

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Black I am and much admired, men seek me until they're tired. When they find me, they break my head, and take from me my resting bed. What am I?
Heading: Not Appreciated

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: Give me an x, I'll stand to face you. Give me a cross, I'll turn my back on you. What am I?
Heading: Capricious

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: My first is high, My second damp, My whole a tie, A writer's cramp. What am I?
Heading: Writer's Cramp Riddle
Answer: Hyphen. The first two lines yield high-fen. A hyphen is used by a writer to tie (or cramp) two words together.

Category: What Am I Riddles, What Am I
Riddle: What can be heard and caught but never seen?
Heading: Catch Me If You Can
